result.execSummary:
The defendant Dywane Neal Beaver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent;  comply with sex offender registry.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 9:11am
INCLUDES 14CF919, 16CF418, 16CF639

PLEA:

16CF418:
Ct. 1 Bail Jumping- Felony- repeater >> NO CONTEST
16CF639:
Ct. 1 Bail Jumping- Felony- repeater >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 14CF919 Ct. 1- 1 year jail. Jail may be with huber release for work or EMP if meets jail criteria. Deft has 45 days to report to jail. Consecutive to 16CF639 Ct. 1 & 16CF418 Ct. 1. Zero days credit granted.
COURT ORDERS: 14CF919 Ct. 2- w/hold sentencing. 1 year probation. Consecutive to 3 years jail. CONDITIONS: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Comply with sex offender registry. If revoked, zero days credit granted. 
COURT ORDERS: 16CF418 Ct. 1- 1 year jail. Jail may be with huber release for work or EMP if meets jail criteria. Deft has 45 days to report to jail. Consecutive to 16CF639 Ct. 1. 365 days jail credit granted.
COURT ORDERS: 16CF639 Ct. 1- 1 year jail. Jail may be with huber release for work or EMP if meets jail criteria. Deft has 45 days to report to jail. Consecutive to 16CF418 Ct. 1. 235 days jail credit granted. 
COURT ORDERS: on all cases to Pay CC. Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample.
COURT ORDERS: $2500 cash bond returned to poster.

State appears by Deputy District Attorney Theresa Wetzsteon. Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty Paul Goetz.

State's says there are 3 motions filed: standard MIL, motion to omit prior convictions of deft, and rape shield information

Motion on prior convictions:
Atty Goetz makes statement regarding prior 3 convictions of defendant
State does not have out of state sentencing from Iowa in 1993
COURT is going to allow the 3 prior convictions to be presented to jurors if deft takes stand to testify

Rape Shield Law:
Atty Goetz makes statement regarding discovery 
Atty Goetz states defense should have credibility to attack credibility of victim
COURT states defense has not filed rape shield law
State gives reasoning for filing rape shield law
State also cites limitations of rape shield law
COURT requires motion to be filed by Atty Goetz on admissibility of rape shield law regarding credibility
COURT grants states MIL rape shield law and prior vicitims sexual conduct will be omitted from jury trial

COURT allows victim to be present during trial; grants states 1st motion
COURT allows sequestion order to begin after jury selection; grants states 2nd motion
COURT grants 3 weeks before trial a list of potential witnesses defense will call be provided to state with names and date of birth; grants states 3rd motion
